pick.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to choose a person or thing, for example because they are the best or most suitable
pick.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Students have to pick three courses from a list of 15.
I don’t know which colour to pick.
Who’s going to pick the team for the match on Saturday?
Russell spoke slowly, picking his words (=choosing what to say) very carefully.
I wasn’t picked for the hockey team.
The hotel was picked as the best small hotel in the area.
He was picked to run in the 100 metres.
pick.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to remove a flower, fruit, nut etc from a plant or tree
pick.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: We picked some blackberries to eat on the way.
Amy picked a small bunch of wild flowers.
a dish of freshly picked peas
pick.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to remove something carefully from a place, especially something small
pick.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Ahmed picked the melon pips from his teeth.
She was nervously picking bits of fluff off her sweater.
The goalkeeper spent a lot of his time picking the ball out of the back of the net.
pick.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to play a musical instrument by pulling at its strings with your fingers
pick.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: if you can have your pick or take your pick of different things, you can choose which one you want
pick.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Have a look at the menu and take your pick.
He knew he could take his pick of any of the girls in the office.
Sarah could have her pick of any university in the country.
She always gets first pick of the videos.
pick.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: your pick is the person or thing that you have chosen from a group
pick.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: There are a lot of good horses in the race, but Archimedes would be my pick.
pick.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: a small flat object that you use for pulling at the strings of a musical instrument such as a guitar
